name: Teriyaki scrimps
description: A quick Asian dish made with pan seared shrimp and a deeply flavorful, sweet and savory teriyaki sauce. Easy to make and worthy of the dinner rotation!

name: Lentil Salad
description: It's made with protein rich lentils, roasted bell pepper, cool crisp cucumber, bright red onion, fresh herbs, tangy feta, and it’s finished with a vibrant lemon dressing. It's the perfect way to upgrade lentils.

name: Crème Brûlée
description: Creme Brûlée – A transcendent dessert made with a few simple ingredients including luscious heavy cream, sweet simple sugar, rich egg yolks, and vanilla bean for premium flavor. It’s the method that makes this impressive treat unique.

name: Chicken Alfredo
description: Such a rich and satisfying Chicken Alfredo recipe! It’s a hearty dish made with fettuccine pasta, a creamy parmesan white sauce, and garlicky pan seared chicken.

name: Turkey Avocado Egg Wraps
description: Turkey Avocado Egg Wraps are so delicious and way easy to make! Here we ditch the flour based wrap and trade it in for a DIY wrap made from eggs. Then we layer in classic sandwich fillings and enjoy it warm and melty.

name: Brown Sugar Glazed Salmon
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Easy Brown Sugar Glazed Salmon – Rich salmon fillets brushed in a simple brown sugar, mustard and garlic mixture then they’re oven baked until tender and flakey. A quick dinner with vibrant and slightly sweet flavor!

name: Cream of Mushroom Soup
ingredients: 6 Tbsp unsalted butter, cut into 1-Tbsp pieces, divided
2 lbs baby bella mushrooms, sliced (aka cremini)
2/3 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc
1 1/2 Tbsp cornstarch well blended with 2 Tbsp water (optional, for more thickening)
description: Homemade Cream of Mushroom Soup – It's a rich and flavorful soup made with sauteed mushrooms and onions, bright herbs, and a creamy broth. It's the ultimate mushroom soup recipe!

name: Smashed Potatoes
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Perfect Smashed Potatoes! Red potatoes are boiled, then smashed and roasted on a baking sheet until crispy on the outside, soft and tender on the inside. It’s a savory side made with simple everyday ingredients that will quickly become the highlight of any meal!

name: Johnny Cakes (Hoecakes)
ingredients: 1 cup (5 oz) all-purpose flour (scoop and level to measure)
1/4 cup rendered bacon drippings or butter, melted
3 1/2 Tbsp vegetable oil for skillet, divided
description: Easy to make Johnny Cakes (AKA Hoecakes)! They are a classic breakfast entree or dinner side that can be served savory with butter alone or sweet topped with honey, jam or maple syrup.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
description: Perfect Chicken Cordon Bleu – made with tender chicken breasts, flavorful black forest ham, tangy Swiss cheese, and a crisp panko finish. And to polish it off it’s highlighted with a creamy garlicky mustard sauce to finish. It may be old fashioned but it’s still absolutely delicious!

name: Pizza Bagels
ingredients: 3 bakery fresh plain bagels, evenly halved
2/3 cup pizza sauce, store bought (I like Rao’s or Kroger’s Simple Truth) or homemade
1/3 cup mini pepperoni, or other toppings of choice
Chopped fresh basil, grated parmesan, red pepper flakes (optional ingredients to finish)
description: Nostalgic Pizza Bagels! A classic childhood favorite made with store-bought fresh bagels and pizza sauce, lots of shredded mozzarella, and any of your favorite toppings. They are unbelievably easy to make and surprisingly delicious!

name: Coconut Cake
description: This Coconut Cake is one of the best cakes you’ll ever make! It’s light and fluffy, it’s brimming with sweet coconut flavor and it’s finished with a rich and creamy cream cheese frosting.  This has been a reader favorite recipe for years and it’s one of my my families favorites!
